DataElement.preferredName: Patient New York Heart Association Class III/IV Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the patient has ischemic heart disease Class III or IV based on the New York Heart Association.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient New York Heart Association Class III/IV Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient or participant having New York Heart Association Class III/IV, the two most severe classes of cardiac dysfunction according to a classification system developed by the New York Heart Association to grade cardiovascular function and disability (Class III - patients with cardiac disease producing marked limitation of activity: comfortable at rest. Less than ordinary physical activity causes symptoms. Class IV - patients with cardiac disease resulting in inability to carry on any physical activity without discomfort), used in determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: New York Heart Association Class III/IV Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: The two most severe classes of cardiac dysfunction according to a classification system developed by the New York Heart Association to grade cardiovascular function and disability. These classes are defined as follows: Class III - patients with cardiac disease producing marked limitation of activity: comfortable at rest. Less than ordinary physical activity causes symptoms. Class IV - patients with cardiac disease resulting in inability to carry on any physical activity without discomfort. Symptoms may be present even at rest.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.longName: New York Heart Association Class III/IV
Concepts.definition: The two most severe classes of cardiac dysfunction according to a classification system developed by the New York Heart Association to grade cardiovascular function and disability. These classes are defined as follows: Class III - patients with cardiac disease producing marked limitation of activity: comfortable at rest. Less than ordinary physical activity causes symptoms. Class IV - patients with cardiac disease resulting in inability to carry on any physical activity without discomfort. Symptoms may be present even at rest.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have Class I
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have Class III or Class IV myocardial disease (New York Heart Association)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have Class III or Class IV cardiac disease or symptomatic arrhythmia

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: New York Heart Association class III or IV cardiovascular disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: New York Heart Association Class III or IV heart failure

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: New York Heart Association (NYHA) classification III or IV congestive heart failure

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Using the New York Heart Association guidelines, does the patient have Class III-IV congestive heart failure?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of  NYHA Class III or IV congestive heart failure

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have currently active clinically significant cardiovascular disease such as uncontrolled arrhythmia, congestive heart failure, any class 3 or 4 cardiac disease as defined by the New York Heart Association Functional Classification, or history of myocardial infarction within 6 months prior to first dose with study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Cardiovascular disease that meets one of the following: congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association Class III or IV), active angina pectoris, or recent myocardial infarction (within the last 6 months)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history of myocardial infarction within six months, unstable angina, resting ECG with clinically significant abnormal findings, or NYHA (New York Heart Association) functional classification of III or IV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a serious cardiac condition, such as congestive heart failure; New York Heart Association Class III/IV heart disease; unstable angina pectoris, or cardiac stenting within 6 months of registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a serious cardiac condition, such as congestive heart failure; New York Heart Association Class II/III/IV heart disease; unstable angina pectoris, or cardiac stenting within 6 months of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a New York Heart Association functional classification of III or IV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has known history or current symptoms of cardiac disease, or history of treatment with cardiotoxic agents, and a New York Heart Association Functional Classification of 2C or worse?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a New York Heart Association functional classification of 2C or worse?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF text 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has known history or current symptoms of cardiac disease, or history of treatment with cardiotoxic agents,a New York Heart Association Functional Classification of 2C or worse?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known history or current symptoms of cardiac disease, or history of treatment with cardiotoxic agents?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
